svg.source:
User->Browser (local JavaScript): Enters Master Password Browser (local JavaScript)->Browser (local JavaScript): Calculates a hash of Master Password Browser (local JavaScript)->Cloud Service: Sends the hash of Master Password Cloud Service->Cloud Service: Verifies the hash Cloud Service->Browser (local JavaScript): Receives the encrypted passwords Browser (local JavaScript)->Browser (local JavaScript): Creates the decryption key from Master Password Browser (local JavaScript)->Browser (local JavaScript): Decrypts the password with the symmetric key Browser (local JavaScript)->User: Displays the password Note over User, Browser (local JavaScript): Local machine only
No network connection here Note over Browser (local JavaScript), Cloud Service: HTTPS connection
Only hashes and encrypted data are transmitted here Note right of Cloud Service: The Cloud Service is unable
to decrypt the passwords
because it never receives
neither the clear Master
Password nor the symmetric key

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-family: 'Andale Mono', monospace; font-size: 16px;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-family: 'Andale Mono', monospace; font-size: 16px;
-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-family: 'Andale Mono', monospace; font-size: 16px;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-family: 'Andale Mono', monospace; font-size: 16px;
text.tspan: Calculates a hash of Master Password

text.tspan: Sends the hash of Master Password

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-family: 'Andale Mono', monospace; font-size: 16px;

text.tspan: Creates the decryption key from Master Password

text.tspan: Decrypts the password with the symmetric key
